title: Create standalone /cover-letter skill
description: Create a dedicated `/cover-letter` skill for generating tailored cover letters. Should follow similar patterns to resume-builder: takes LinkedIn PDF + job description, outputs HTML cover letter to output/ directory.
design:
## Design Decisions

### Inputs
- Requires a generated resume first (from /resume-builder)
- LinkedIn PDF + Job Description (same as resume-builder)
- Optional: personal context/story if the skill detects it would strengthen the application

### Behavior
1. Read the generated resume to ensure consistency
2. Analyze JD to detect if personal story would help (startups, mission-driven companies)
3. If yes, prompt user for personal context relevant to the role
4. Detect region from JD, prompt user to confirm regional format
5. Generate cover letter that references achievements from the resume

### Styling
- Must match resume template (same colors, fonts, branding)
- When template-builder exists, use custom template if available

### Regional Variations
- US: Brief, direct, 3 paragraphs max
- EU: More formal, can be longer
- Germany: Very formal tone
- Nordics: Can be slightly informal
- Prompt user to confirm detected region

### Output
- HTML file in output/ directory
- Naming: cover_letter_[company]_[role].html
close_reason: Implemented /cover-letter skill with: resume prerequisite, matching styling, personal context prompting for startups/mission-driven roles, regional format detection with user confirmation

title: Add automated PDF export via Puppeteer/Playwright
description: Create a CLI tool/script to convert generated HTML resumes and cover letters to PDF automatically, eliminating the manual Chrome print step. Use Puppeteer or Playwright for accurate rendering with A4 sizing.
design:
## Design Decisions

### Trigger
- Manual CLI command (not auto-integrated into skills)
- Can add skill integration later if needed

### Tool
- Puppeteer (Chrome-specific, lighter weight)

### Usage
- Single file conversion: `npm run pdf output/resume.html`
- Converts one HTML file to PDF

### Output
- PDFs saved to `pdf/` directory
- Same filename, different extension: `resume.html` â†’ `pdf/resume.pdf`

### Implementation
- Node.js script using Puppeteer
- A4 page size, no margins (matches manual Chrome print settings)
- Background graphics enabled
close_reason: Implemented PDF export with: Puppeteer CLI tool, new outputs/[job]/ directory structure, updated both skills to use new structure

title: Add ATS keyword analysis to resume-builder
description: Add optional `--analyze` flag to resume-builder skill that shows a keyword match report after generation: which JD keywords were included, which are missing, frequency analysis, and suggestions for improvement.
design:
## Design Decisions

### Keyword Extraction
- Automatic extraction from job description
- AI identifies: skills, technologies, qualifications, soft skills, domain terms

### Report Content
- Keywords found (with frequency count)
- Keywords missing
- Actionable suggestions: where/how to add missing keywords

### Timing
- Always runs after resume generation
- Shown as a review step before finalizing

### Output Format
- Text-based report shown to user
- Grouped by category (technical skills, soft skills, etc.)
- Clear action items for improvement
close_reason: Added Step 6 to resume-builder skill: automatic keyword analysis with categorized report, match score, missing keywords with suggestions, and offer to revise
